intro: Launaea polyclada, commonly known as the desert sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy structures. The plant has alternate, hairy leaves that are often lobed or toothed, and it produces small yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. Launaea polyclada is adapted to survive in harsh environments, with mechanisms to conserve water and withstand high temperatures. It is sometimes considered a weed but can also play a role in stabilizing sandy soils.
